elements.label: Digital Dependency in Africa
elements.description: The systemic reliance on external actors for digital infrastructure, governance, and services across African nations.

elements.label: Foreign Tech Companies
elements.description: Own and control most cloud platforms, undersea cables, and data processing infrastructure used across Africa.

elements.label: African Governments
elements.description: Set policy frameworks, negotiate infrastructure deals, and act as both implementers and intermediaries.

elements.label: Donor Institutions
elements.description: Finance digital infrastructure projects, often with conditions that reinforce dependence.

elements.label: Local Startups & Developers
elements.description: Create local solutions but face structural barriers to scale, infrastructure, and funding.

elements.label: Citizens
elements.description: Most affected by digital systems but hold the least power to shape them.

elements.label: Civil Society & NGOs
elements.description: Advocate for inclusion, rights, and accountability within the digital ecosystem.

elements.label: Funding Flows
elements.description: Movement of capital that determines what infrastructure is built, and by whom.

elements.label: Infrastructure Ownership
elements.description: Control over digital infrastructure assets like cables, data centers, and towers.

elements.label: Policy Influence
elements.description: The ability to shape laws and frameworks governing digital technologies.

elements.label: Data Ownership & Control
elements.description: Determines who stores, processes, and profits from user and platform data.
